name: maize silage production | maize silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/12976/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg fresh matter of maize silage in the region of Québec. The 2010-2012 average yield is 36330 kg/ha (wet mass) at a moisture content at storage of 65%.

This activity starts with soil cultivation after the harvest of the previous crop.

This activity ends after harvest and ensiling of maize plant, at the farm gate. The dataset includes the inputs of seeds, mineral and organic fertilisers applied, pesticides and all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, transport of seeds, fertilisers and pesticides to the field (15 km), sowing, fertilisation, weed control, pest and pathogen control, plant cutting, loading, transport to farm and discharge into silo. Direct field emissions are also included. No irrigation is involved for maize production in Québec.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/011:Growing of non-perennial crops/0119:Growing of other non-perennial crops

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for the region of Québec (Canada).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Transports are modelled with standard distances. Machine usage is modelled with Québec diesel consumptions and field works (Beauregard, 2013) and Swiss machines. Mineral fertilizer types are extrapolated from overall mineral fertilizers sales in Québec (APNC 2011). Organic fertilizer types are extrapolated from animal manure supply data, per region in Québec, communicated by the Ministry of Agriculture (MAPAQ). Data about agricultural management practices are from BPR (2008. Suivi 2007 du Portrait agroenvironnemental des fermes du Que´bec). Emissions are calculated with standard methods according to ecoinvent documentation (Nemecek and Schnetzer, 2011. '01 crop production-direct field emissions natural resources' v1.2, August 2011, available at https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports) and the World Food LCA Database guidelines (Nemecek et al. 2014, available at http://www.quantis-intl.com/microsites/wfldb/), except for : 1) pesticides emitted fractions (modelled using PestLCI 2.0, a global model, considering Québec average conditions for model input parameters, and considering that the degradation/uptake fraction calculated by PestLCI is actually emitted to soil - see the supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' for rationale), 2) phosphorus and phosphate emissions (modelled using ODEP, a Québec model, considering geospatialized weighted average conditions for soil, hydrology, and agricultural management practices), and 3) ammonia emissions from organic fertilizers which are calculated according to Québec conditions and agricultural management practices (coefficients are taken from Parent et Gagné (2010 and 2013 update). Furthermore, an IPCC Tier 2 approach is used for N2O emissions using regional and ecodistrict-based emission factors (Rochette et al., 2008). Due to lack of comprehensive data on pesticides use for Québec, data from a 2008 survey in the neighbouring province of Ontario are used (OMAFRA, 2008). Uncertainty in terms of the variance of the logtransformed data is the default value as provided by the Data Quality Guidelines for ecoinvent v3 (available at http://www.ecoinvent.org/support/documents-and-files/). Details on modelling and calculations are reported in the supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature and statistics data, opinions of experts in the field of agricultural production and agroeconomists.

exchanges.description: Modelled with PestLCI 2.0 (Dijkman et al. 2012). See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

NH3 from mineral fertilisers are calculated with the emission factors published in the EMEP guidelines from the European Environment Agency (EEA, 2013). NH3 from manure are calculated according to the caracteristics of every manure, and to Quebec figures for period and method of maqnure application, and delay before incorporation of manure into the soil (Parent et Gagné, 2010; 2013). See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

Calculated value. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of maize silage is calculated to be circa 5.22E-05 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'atrazine', 'benzoic-compound', 'dimethenamide', 'glyphosate', 'metolachlor', 'pendimethalin', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'pyrethroid-compound'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.04E-04 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.

exchanges.description: Modelled with the 'SQCB-NO3 model' described in '01 crop production-direct field emissions natural resources v1.2.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports). Québec average conditions are considered for the SQCB-NO3 model input parameters (see supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports)).

Modelled with PestLCI 2.0. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

Amount is determined from the mineral nutrient used for the crop (Beauregard, 2013) and from the overall mineral fertilizers sales, by type of fertilizer, in Québec for agriculture (APNC, 2010). Mono- and di-ammonium phosphate (MAP and DAP), as P2O5. The concommitant supply of nitrogen by DAP is accounted for in total N requirements. See supporting documentation '01 crop production - Québec.pdf' available on ecoinvent reports web page (https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/File/Reports).

exchanges.description: Total amount of active substance/s of fertilisers needed for the production of 'maize silage' is calculated to be circa 8.00E-03 kg. Fertiliser/s used in this dataset is/are: 'ammonia, liquid', 'ammonium nitrate, as N', 'ammonium sulfate, as N', 'lime', 'nitrogen fertiliser, as N', 'phosphate fertiliser, as P2O5', 'urea, as N'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of fertiliser/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 1.60E-02 kg of packaging for fertilisers is justified with this exchange.
